name: Password Complexity - PCI Compliance/AD Settings
description: This pattern matches Active Directory's (Windows 2008) Password Complexity validation for having 3 of 4 of the following items: lower case upper case numbers special charactersAdditional checks:- No more than 3 repeating chars- 7-30 charsThe verification was driven by PCI Compliance.^ # beginning of line anchor(?!.*(.)\1{3}) #check for repeating group((?=.*[\d])  #check for digits(?=.*[a-z]) #check for lower case(?=.*[A-Z])  #check for upper case|(?=.*[a-z]) (?=.*[A-Z]) (?=.*[^\w\d\s]) #check for special chars|(?=.*[\d])  (?=.*[A-Z]) (?=.*[^\w\d\s])|(?=.*[\d])  (?=.*[a-z]) (?=.*[^\w\d\s])).{7,20} #match any character 7-20 times$ #end of line anchor
author: Steve Eidenschink
